bug.author: Squadrick
bug.summary: [DOCS] Using `>>>` in documentation is incorrectly formatted on website
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>URL(s) with the issue:</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-link:https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/tf/constant_initializer>https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/tf/constant_initializer</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-h:h2>Description of issue (what needs changing):</denchmark-h>
The <denchmark-link:https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/1cf0898dd4331baf93fe77205550f2c2e6c90ee5/tensorflow/python/ops/init_ops_v2.py#L152>example code</denchmark-link> uses , but on the website, this is incorrectly converted to TF docs link: <denchmark-link:https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/tf/constant_initializer>https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/tf/constant_initializer</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-h:h3>Submit a pull request?</denchmark-h>
This is more of a problem with how documentation is generated from comments in the python file. I don't mind taking a look if someone can point out where to get started.
